title: Error Types and Causes
content: Errors fall into categories: slips (right intention, wrong action), lapses (forgetting), mistakes (wrong intention based on misunderstanding), and violations (intentional deviation). Each type has different causes and countermeasures. Treating all errors the same misses effective prevention.

mcq.question: An operator intends to press button A but presses adjacent button B. What type of error is this?
mcq.explanation: A slip is correct intention with execution failure—the knowledge is right but the action is wrong. This differs from mistakes (wrong knowledge) or violations (deliberate deviation). Interface design that prevents slips is the countermeasure.

openQuestions: What types of errors are most common in your work?
How do countermeasures differ for slips versus mistakes?
